newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Maracana tender document due Oct 31 -report.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Maracana tender document due Oct 31 -report.

text.p: The tender document for the privatisation of Brazil's world famous football stadium, the Maracana, will be published on October 31, said private Invest News agency.

Citing Rio de Janeiro state official Raul Raposo, Invest News said interested companies or groups would need to spend between 40 million and 50 million reais on reforms, including the latest state-of-the-art signs and numbered seats.

Companies would also have to commit themselves to renovating the entire Maracana complex including the Maracanazinho stadium and the Celio de Barros athletics stadium which can seat 9,143 spectators, Invest News said.
The minimum price for leasing the complex, to be operated on a concession basis for 30 years, is 500,000 reais a year. Bids for the concession should be delivered on January 21 next year.
Foreign and Brazilian companies can participate in the auction, Invest News added.
Raposo said that annual operating costs at the Maracana were around 10 million reais against returns of five to six million.
More than 20 firms have already made enquiries about the stadium, including the U.S.' Leisure Management International, Invest News said.
-- Caroline Bulloch, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 5074151
